history.proof: unfold nat_to_ring. hauto use: @sum_n_Sm, not_le, Nat.nle_succ_0 unfold: Ring.AbelianGroup, gt, lt, AbelianGroup.sort.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: Ring
n: nat

Goal:
nat_to_ring (S n) = plus (nat_to_ring n) one

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
plus = fun G : AbelianGroup => AbelianGroup.plus G (AbelianGroup.class G) : forall G : AbelianGroup, G -> G -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted
nat_to_ring = fun n : nat => sum_n_m (fun _ : nat => one) 1 n : nat -> K Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Nat2Z.inj_succ : forall n : nat, Z.of_nat (S n) = Z.succ (Z.of_nat n)
matrix_AbelianGroup = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat) => AbelianGroup.Pack (matrix m n) matrix_AbelianGroup_mixin (matrix m n) : AbelianGroup -> nat -> nat -> AbelianGroup Arguments G, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope nat_scope]
matrix_Ring = fun (T : Ring) (n : nat) => Ring.Pack (matrix n n) {| Ring.base := matrix_AbelianGroup_mixin; Ring.mixin := matrix_Ring_mixin |} (matrix n n) : Ring -> nat -> Ring Arguments T, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope]
matrix_ModuleSpace = fun (T : Ring) (m n : nat) => ModuleSpace.Pack matrix_Ring (matrix m n) {| ModuleSpace.base := matrix_AbelianGroup_mixin; ModuleSpace.mixin := matrix_ModuleSpace_mixin |} (matrix m n) : forall (T : Ring) (m : nat), nat -> ModuleSpace matrix_Ring Arguments T, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope nat_scope]
PS_decr_1 = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (a : nat -> V) (n : nat) => a (S n) : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (nat -> V) -> nat -> V Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope nat_scope]
sum_Sn : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n0 : nat), sum_n a (S n0) = plus (sum_n a n0) (a (S n0)) where ?G : [K : Ring n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_Sm : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n0 m : nat), (n0 <= S m)%nat -> sum_n_m a n0 (S m) = plus (sum_n_m a n0 m) (a (S m)) where ?G : [K : Ring n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
nat_to_ring_O = (fun (_evar_0_ : zero = zero) (_evar_0_0 : (0 < 1)%nat) => eq_ind_r (fun _pattern_value_ : K => _pattern_value_ = zero) _evar_0_ (sum_n_m_zero (fun _ : nat => one) 1 0 _evar_0_0)) eq_refl (le_n 1) : nat_to_ring 0 = zero
Mplus = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat) (A B : matrix m n) => mk_matrix m n (fun i j : nat => plus (coeff_mat zero A i j) (coeff_mat zero B i j)) : forall (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat), matrix m n -> matrix m n -> matrix m n Arguments G, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope nat_scope _ _]
Record mixin_of (K : AbelianGroup) : Type := Mixin { mult : K -> K -> K; one : AbelianGroup.sort K; ax1 : forall x y z : K, mult x (mult y z) = mult (mult x y) z; ax2 : forall x : K, mult x one = x; ax3 : forall x : K, mult one x = x; ax4 : forall x y z : K, mult (plus x y) z = plus (mult x z) (mult y z); ax5 : forall x y z : K, mult x (plus y z) = plus (mult x y) (mult x z) } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope _ function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
Ring.Mixin : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (mult : K -> K -> K) (one : K), (forall x y z : K, mult x (mult y z) = mult (mult x y) z) -> (forall x : K, mult x one = x) -> (forall x : K, mult one x = x) -> (forall x y z : K, mult (plus x y) z = plus (mult x z) (mult y z)) -> (forall x y z : K, mult x (plus y z) = plus (mult x y) (mult x z)) -> Ring.mixin_of K
matrix_AbelianGroup_mixin = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat) => {| AbelianGroup.plus := Mplus; AbelianGroup.opp := Mopp; AbelianGroup.zero := Mzero; AbelianGroup.ax1 := Mplus_comm; AbelianGroup.ax2 := Mplus_assoc; AbelianGroup.ax3 := Mplus_zero_r; AbelianGroup.ax4 := Mplus_opp_r |} : forall (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat), AbelianGroup.mixin_of (matrix m n) Arguments G, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope nat_scope]
sum_n_m_S : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n0 m : nat), sum_n_m (fun n : nat => a (S n)) n0 m = sum_n_m a (S n0) (S m) where ?G : [K : Ring n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
sum_Sn_m : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n0 m : nat), (n0 <= m)%nat -> sum_n_m a n0 m = plus (a n0) (sum_n_m a (S n0) m) where ?G : [K : Ring n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
coeff_mat = fun (T : Type) (m n : nat) (x0 : T) (A : matrix m n) (i j : nat) => coeff_Tn x0 (coeff_Tn (mk_Tn n (fun _ : nat => x0)) A i) j : forall (T : Type) (m n : nat), T -> matrix m n -> nat -> nat -> T Arguments T, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope nat_scope nat_scope _ _ nat_scope nat_scope]
sum_n_m_Chasles : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n0 m k : nat), (n0 <= S m)%nat -> (m <= k)%nat -> sum_n_m a n0 k = plus (sum_n_m a n0 m) (sum_n_m a (S m) k) where ?G : [K : Ring n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
ModuleSpace.Mixin : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (scal : K -> V -> V), (forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u) -> (forall u : V, scal one u = u) -> (forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v)) -> (forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u)) -> ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V
lt = fun n m : nat => (S n <= m)%nat : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Mone_seq_diag : forall i j : nat, i = j -> Mone_seq i j = one where ?T : [K : Ring n : nat |- Ring]
mult_one_r : forall x : ?K, mult x one = x where ?K : [K : Ring n : nat |- Ring]
mult_one_l : forall x : ?K, mult one x = x where ?K : [K : Ring n : nat |- Ring]
plus_reg_l : forall r x y : ?G, plus r x = plus r y -> x = y where ?G : [K : Ring n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
plus_reg_r : forall r x y : ?G, plus x r = plus y r -> x = y where ?G : [K : Ring n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
Record mixin_of (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) : Type := Mixin { scal : K -> V -> V; ax1 : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u; ax2 : forall u : V, scal one u = u; ax3 : forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v); ax4 : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u) } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
ModuleSpace.ax2 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (u : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m one u = u
plus_comm : forall x y : ?G, plus x y = plus y x where ?G : [K : Ring n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
one = fun K : Ring => Ring.one (AbelianGroup.Pack K (Ring.class K) K) (Ring.class K) : forall K : Ring, K Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted
abs_one = fun K : AbsRing => (fun _evar_0_ : abs (opp one) = 1 => eq_ind (abs (opp one)) (fun _pattern_value_ : R => _pattern_value_ = 1) _evar_0_ (abs one) (abs_opp one)) abs_opp_one : forall K : AbsRing, abs one = 1 Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted
plus_assoc : forall x y z : ?G, plus x (plus y z) = plus (plus x y) z where ?G : [K : Ring n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
scal_one : forall u : ?V, scal one u = u where ?K : [K : Ring n : nat |- Ring] ?V : [K : Ring n : nat |- ModuleSpace ?K]

```coq
unfold nat_to_ring.
rewrite sum_Sn_m with (a := fun _ : nat => one) (n0 := n) (m := S n).
rewrite sum_n_m_S with (a := fun _ : nat => one) (n0 := n) (m := S n).
rewrite sum_Sn_m with (a := fun _ : nat => one) (n0 := S n) (m := S n).
rewrite sum_n_m_S with (a := fun _ : nat => one) (n0 := S n) (m := S n).
rewrite <- sum_Sn_m_S with (a := fun _ : nat => one) (n0 := n) (m := S n).
rewrite <- sum_n_m_S with (a := fun _ : nat => one) (n0 := n) (m := S n).
rewrite sum_Sn_m with (a := fun _ : nat => one) (n0 := n) (m := S n).
rewrite sum_n_m with (a := fun _ : nat => one) (n0 := 0) (m := S n).
rewrite sum_n_m_zero with (a := fun _ : nat => one) (n0 := 0) (m := S n).
rewrite sum_n_m_S with (a := fun _ : nat => one) (n0 := 0) (m := S n).
rewrite sum_n_m with (a := fun _ : nat => one) (n0 := 0) (m := S n).
rewrite sum_n_m_zero with (a := fun _ : nat => one) (n0 := 0) (m := S n).
rewrite <- nat_to_ring_O.
auto.
Qed.
